column5: Anyone have an idea. Mine is shot.
The Source sells them.  Bought one the other day.  http://www.thesource.ca/estore/product.aspx?language=en-CA&catalog=Online&category=Specialty+Batteries&product=2318250
Most any place that sells automotive batteries either has them in stock and can get them overnight.
Holy grapola, that's worse than being held up, that's outright thievery, $59 + tax.  I'm bettin McGuinty runs that store.  You can get them for less than $30.
I buy them at Total Battery in Ottawa. There must be a Battery store where you are.  I would not pay more than $25.00 for one.
Check Dan's ad in the classified. Just got mine and it works great!
You can get them at any electrical supply shop. Usually around 20-30 bucks.  S.
princess auto in whitby is were I got mine $18.99
Have a new one for sale for $20. My humminbird flasher died and i thought it was battery only to find out it wasnt.
